variants.Description in input context: This variant causes a structural change in the protein, affecting its function.

Variants Include.Effect: reduced protein stability and impaired transcriptional activity

variants.Description in input context: This frameshift mutation results in a premature stop codon and a truncated protein product

Material used.Description: The experiment was conducted using the HEK293 cell line.  Cells were transfected with plasmids expressing wild-type TP53 and each mutant variant.

Readout description.Result Description: Protein expression was reduced by 50% for the variant NM_001126112.3:c.248G>A.  The observed decrease in expression correlated with a visible band shift on SDS-PAGE, indicating altered protein migration.
The variant NM_001126112.3:c.300delG resulted in no detectable protein expression, suggesting a complete loss of protein synthesis.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed.  Each replicate involved independent transfections and protein lysate preparation.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate on the Western blot apparatus to ensure reliability of band intensity measurements.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type cDNA TP53 expression served as a positive control demonstrating normal protein expression and migration.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector transfection served as a negative control demonstrating absence of detectable TP53 protein.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used for statistical analysis. P-values were adjusted for multiple comparisons using the Bonferroni method.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein expression greater than 80% on day 7, based on densitometric analysis of Western blot bands.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein expression less than 50% on day 7, or the presence of aberrant band migration patterns.

Material used.Description: Muscle tissue was obtained from mice exhibiting symptoms of Hereditary Myopathy.

Readout description.Result Description: Immunofluorescence staining revealed reduced and altered cellular localization of the TP53 protein in muscle fibers carrying the NM_001126112.3:c.248G>A variant.
The variant NM_001126112.3:c.300delG resulted in a lack of detectable TP53 protein using immunofluorescence staining

Biological replicates.Description: Four sections from each of the affected muscles were prepared for immunofluoresence staining

Technical replicates.Description: Each section was visualized under at least three different magnifications
